name: Fates
description: Three sisters weave, measure, and cut the threads of fate. This card explores the repercussions of decisions and reflects on the past.

person.upright: A person perhaps nearing the end of their life, troubled by past mistakes or reflecting on prior decisions.
person.reverse: A person driven by the desire to escape whatever fate has in store.

creatureTrap.upright: A supernatural creature connected to fate, such as a Celestial, modron, or hag.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature strongly associated with chaos, such as a demon or a slaad.

place.upright: Somewhere meant for literal or metaphorical reflection, such as a room full of mirrors, a still mountain lake, a monastery, a hermitage, or a library.
place.reverse: A place that discourages reflection, such as a dark place or a noisy, busy one.

treasure.upright: An ornate or magical mirror, tapestry, or other woven treasure; alternatively, magic that can alter fate.
treasure.reverse: An art object depicting the effort to escape fate, or a magic item powered by chaos.

situation.upright: A situation ordained by fate, perhaps involving a supernatural punishment or reward.
situation.reverse: An unjust situation where evil is rewarded and good is punished.
